opendial.bn.distribs

Class MultivariateTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.distribs.MultivariateTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MultivariateDistribution

    public class MultivariateTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements MultivariateDistribution
    Representation of a multivariate categorical table P(X1,...Xn), where X1,...Xn are random variables.
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Logger log 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MultivariateTable()
      Constructs a new probability table, with no values
      MultivariateTable(Assignment uniqueValue)
      Create a categorical table with a unique value with probability 1.0.
      MultivariateTable(CategoricalTable headTable)
      Constructs a new multivariate table from a univariate table.
      MultivariateTable(java.util.Map<Assignment,java.lang.Double> headTable)
      Constructs a new probability table with a mapping between head variable assignments and probability values.

      • log

        public static Logger log

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultivariateTable

        public MultivariateTable()
        Constructs a new probability table, with no values

      • MultivariateTable

        public MultivariateTable(java.util.Map<Assignment,java.lang.Double> headTable)
        Constructs a new probability table with a mapping between head variable assignments and probability values. The construction assumes that the distribution does not have any conditional variables.
        Parameters:
        headTable - the mapping to fill the table

      • MultivariateTable

        public MultivariateTable(CategoricalTable headTable)
        Constructs a new multivariate table from a univariate table.
        Parameters:
        headTable - the univariate table.

      • MultivariateTable

        public MultivariateTable(Assignment uniqueValue)
        Create a categorical table with a unique value with probability 1.0.
        Parameters:
        uniqueValue - the unique value for the table

    • Method Detail

      • addRow

        public void addRow(Assignment head,
                   double prob)
        Adds a new row to the probability table, assuming no conditional assignment. If the table already contains a probability, it is erased.
        Parameters:
        head - the assignment for X1...Xn
        prob - the associated probability

      • incrementRow

        public void incrementRow(Assignment head,
                         double prob)
        Increments the probability specified in the table for the given head assignment. If none exists, simply assign the probability.
        Parameters:
        head - the head assignment
        prob - the probability increment

      • addRows

        public void addRows(java.util.Map<Assignment,java.lang.Double> heads)
        Add a new set of rows to the probability table.
        Parameters:
        heads - the mappings (head assignment, probability value)

      • extendRows

        public void extendRows(Assignment assign)
        Extend all rows in the table with the given value assignment
        Parameters:
        assign - the value assignment

      • removeRow

        public void removeRow(Assignment head)
        Removes a row from the table.
        Parameters:
        head - head assignment

        public java.util.Set<Assignment> getValues()
        Returns the rows of the table

        public double getProb(Assignment head)
        Returns the probability P(head).
        Specified by:
        getProb in interface MultivariateDistribution
        Parameters:
        head - the head assignment
        Returns:
        the associated probability, if one exists.

      • getMarginal

        public CategoricalTable getMarginal(java.lang.String variable)
        Returns the marginal distribution P(Xi) for a random variable Xi in X1,...Xn.
        Specified by:
        getMarginal in interface MultivariateDistribution
        Parameters:
        variable - the variable Xi
        Returns:
        the distribution P(Xi).

      • hasProb

        public boolean hasProb(Assignment head)
        returns true if the table contains a probability for the given assignment
        Parameters:
        head - the assignment
        Returns:
        true if the table contains a row for the assignment, false otherwise

      • sample

        public Assignment sample()
                  throws DialException
        Sample an assignment from the distribution. If no assignment can be sampled (due to e.g. an ill-formed distribution), returns an empty assignment.
        Specified by:
        sample in interface MultivariateDistribution
        Returns:
        the sampled assignment
        Throws:
        DialException - if no assignment could be sampled

      • getVariables

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getVariables()
        Returns the set of variable labels used in the table
        Specified by:
        getVariables in interface MultivariateDistribution
        Returns:
        the variable labels in the table

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if the table is empty (or contains only a default assignment), false otherwise
        Returns:
        true if empty, false otherwise

      • getNBest

        public MultivariateTable getNBest(int nbest)
        Returns a subset of the N values in the table with the highest probability.
        Parameters:
        nbest - the number of values to select
        Returns:
        the distribution with the subset of values

      • getBest

        public Assignment getBest()
        Returns the most likely assignment of values in the table. If none could be found, returns an empty assignment.
        Specified by:
        getBest in interface MultivariateDistribution
        Returns:
        the assignment with highest probability

      • modifyVariableId

        public void modifyVariableId(java.lang.String oldVarId,
                             java.lang.String newVarId)
        Modifies the variable identifiers.
        Specified by:
        modifyVariableId in interface MultivariateDistribution
        Parameters:
        oldVarId - the old identifier to replace
        newVarId - the new identifier

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns the hashcode for the table.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • isWellFormed

        public boolean isWellFormed()
        Returns true if the probability table is well-formed. The method checks that all possible assignments for the condition and head parts are covered in the table, and that the probabilities add up to 1.0f.
        Specified by:
        isWellFormed in interface MultivariateDistribution
        Returns:
        true if the table is well-formed, false otherwise

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the probability table

        Returns:
        the string representation

        Specified by:
